column4: so umm.. can I move a swap file partition while I'm still actively in the recovery console?
I apparently jacked something up when making the partitions.
cause my linux and swap are at the end of the disk and there's not enough room.
so like if you had to, you could reinstall and redo the partitions, right?
honestly, if I were you, I'd just reinstall and pay really close attention to where I put the partitions this time around. I mean, it's not like you're going to loose anything
I'm still voting on a reinstall of the OS and repartitioning.
do you have a second machine that you could download the iso with and burn off?
or for that matter, is there enough room on your current partions to log in and download the iso?
what version of Ubuntu did you install?
when do you need the machine up and running?
you can always request a CD from Cannonical. It's free
maybe you need to go to the computer store tomorrow instead of your friend's place eh? LOL ;) :D
I remember well the days of RedHat 6
I did just that. My little Celeron Ubuntu box is a print server, a file server, a web server and an SSH server.
have you googled to see if you can install Ubuntu straight off the internet?
don't be afraid to ask questions. That's what we're here for
